New Records: The first century by a batter in the India vs Australia title clash would be the 40th century in the 2023 edition.
Virat Kohli has an aggregate of 711 runs in this edition. 39 runs more, and he will become the first batter to aggregate 750 or more runs in a single edition of the World Cup.

Mohammad Shami of India and Adam Zampa of Australia have captured 23 and 22 wickets, respectively, in the ICC Cricket World Cup 2023. They can become the third and fourth bowlers to capture 25 or more wickets in an edition of the World Cup.

Ravindra Jadeja has captured 27 wickets in the World Cup. Three more wickets would fetch him 30 wickets and with it he would become the fourth left-arm spinner to take 30 or more wickets in the World Cup.
Adam Zampa has captured 27 wickets in the World Cup. Three more, and he will become the seventh Australian bowler to capture 30 or more wickets in the World Cup.
David Warner has an aggregate of 1470 runs as an opening batter in the World Cup. 30 more runs, and he will become the second opener to aggregate 1500 or more runs.
Virat Kohli has an aggregate of 1741 runs in the World Cup. Three more, and he will displace Ricky Ponting (1743) as the second-highest scorer in the World Cup.
